intro: Filago germanica var. desertorum, commonly known as the desert filago, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in sandy soils and thrives in environments with low moisture and high sunlight exposure. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months, followed by fluffy, wind-dispersed seeds. Due to its hardy nature, it is often found in disturbed or marginal habitats, contributing to the ecological diversity of its native range.
